page.title: 01Our Area
page.content: This area is in the Dales, on the edge of the National park. The limestone dale was carved out by a glacier many years ago. It contains Swale river it is the fastest rivers in England. The rough hilly land is ideal for Swaledale sheep and can only be used for cattle if the grass has been treated with special fertilizer. The area attracts many tourists, particulary walkers, the Coast to Coast walk goes through the centre of our area. The Swaleview caravan site caters for many tourists. There are some racing stables, the horses train on the old race course. At the eastern edge of the area is the town cemetery and the beginning of a council housing estate. The area is basically rural and noted for its scenery.
